result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal D Rice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Proceedings - Held on 7-19-19 - Partial Transcript Plea & Sentencing Hearing
Notice of Completion of Representation

Court calls 16CF6 & 18CF278 @10:33 AM Defendant Crystal D Rice in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert. Elizabeth Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives plea agreement, Statement in uncharged filed with court because CCAP is down,  16CF6 DEJ revoked on ct 1, 18CF278 plea ct's 1 2 3 & 4, 18CF278 3 1/2 years prison, 18 months initial confinement, 24 extended supervision, stayed 3 years probation, costs, DNA surcharge and sample, AODA and follow through with treatment recommendation, Maintain absolute sobriety, Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for. Counseling deemed by agent ct 2 withheld sentence 3 years probation, costs, DNA Surcharge and comply with conditions ct 1, ct 3 90 days jail, imposed & stayed 1 year probation, costs, DNA surcharge comply with conditions in ct 1, ct 4 30 days jail, imposed and stay 1 year probation, costs, DNA Surcharge comply with conditions in ct 1. 16CF6 withheld sentence 3 years probation, costs, DNA Surcharge and comply with condition in 18CF278.  Sentence credit can't be figure because no WIFI. Atty Seifert and def. agree with agreement.  18CF278   Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and bind over. Atty Seifert has copy of information and waives reading.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Def. understands charges and penalties. Ct 1 Bailjumping, no contest plea, Ct 2 Poss of Meth, no contest plea,  Ct 3 Poss of THC no contest plea & Ct 4 Poss of Drg Paraph, no contest plea. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Atty Seifert is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts pleas and finds def. Guilty to Ct 1 Bailjumping, Ct 2 Poss of Meth, Ct 3 Poss of THC & Ct 4 Poss of Drg Paraph.  Sentencing recommendation by State. Atty Seifert request joint recommendation.  Def. makes statement.  Court approves joint recommendation & orders on 16CF6 Court revoke DEJ & orders Ct 1 withheld sentence 3 years probation, costs, $250 DNA Surcharge, AODA and follow through with treatment recommendation deemed by agent Maintain absolute sobriety, Maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for. Counseling deemed by agent.
18CF278 Ct 1 - 3 1/2 years prison, 18 months initial confinement, 24 extended supervision, stayed 3 years probation, costs, $250 DNA surcharge and sample, Same conditions in 16CF6
ct 2 withheld sentence 3 years probation, costs, $250 DNA Surcharge and comply with conditions Same conditions in 16CF6
ct 3 90 days jail, consecutive to any sentence serving, huber, imposed & stayed 1 year probation, costs, $200 DNA surcharge Same conditions in 16CF6 
ct 4 30 days jail, consecutive to any sentence serving, huber, imposed and stay 1 year probation, costs, $200  DNA Surcharge, Same condition in 16CF6. No credit 
 Def. is eligible for program.  Def. advised of firearm and voting rights.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Court applies bond to costs.

Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement

Defendant Crystal D Rice in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 3:55 pm  Agreement, def to plea Ct 1, Ct 4, & Ct 5.  Ct 2,3 & 6 to be dismissed.  Ct 1 - DEJ  Ct 4 & 5 Probation with cost & AODA  Plea questionnaire form completed and reviewed.  Ct 1 guilty  Ct 4 guilty  Ct 5 guilty plea.  Ct 2,3 & 6 Dismissed and read in consistent with plea agreement  Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements reviewed.  Court finds def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Factual basis for pleas.  Court finds pleas entered freely & voluntarily, Found guilty.  Ct 1 Deferred entry of judgment.  Court signs.  Deferred for 2 yrs.  Sentencing arguments by state.  Atty Grubofski presents sentencing arguments.  Statement by def.  Sentencing remarks by court.  Court orders Ct 4 Sentence withheld 1 yr probation  AODA assessment & follow through.  Counseling as recommendation.  DNA surcharge & cost  Bond to be applied.  Credit 2 days if revoked.  Ct 5 Sentence withheld 1 yr probation   AODA & follow through  Court cost & DNA surcharge.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.   Post conviction rights.  Review hearing scheduled for September 7, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Crystal D Rice in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 9:35 a.m. State gives statement & request adjournment on sentencing but will waive p.h. Court will grant adjournment, but will waive preliminary hearing.  Atty Grubofski explains to def regarding waiver of p.h. Court goes over Waiver of p.h. examination.   Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over.  Information Filed. Atty Grubofski has copy of information, waives reading and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts.  Court will receive Not Guilty plea to all 6 ct's.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
